items.title: World-first organ donation after mum self-administers VAD medication
items.description: An Australian woman is believed to have become the first person in the world to donate organs after self-administering oral voluntary assisted dying medication.

items.title: Political outlook 'dramatically shifted' after Bondi
items.description: What are you watching in Australian politics in 2026? That's the question we put to the ABC's political journalists and columnists.

items.title: Flooded Qld graziers to get $2m support as pilots muster stranded livestock
items.description: Floodwaters remain in outback Queensland as graziers start to tally up livestock losses. Major flooding is possible in the north-west, with king tides forecast on the east coast.

items.title: 'Irresponsible': Sparklers and venue become focus of Swiss bar blaze probe
items.description: The prevalence of sparklers at a Swiss ski resort bar where dozens of people died in a fire has been branded "irresponsible", as authorities probe potential compliance issues there.

items.title: Two truths and a lie: Inside the China-Taiwan-US triangle
items.description: The US has no intention of abandoning Taiwan. But it also has no intention of binding itself to an automatic war commitment on a timeline it does not control.

items.title: Trump says US will 'come to their rescue' if Iran kills protesters
items.description: President Donald Trump says the United States is "locked and loaded" to respond if Iran kills protesters, prompting Tehran to warn that intervention would destabilise the region.

items.title: Red and yellow flags can be confusing. Is it time to change them?
items.description: Every summer in Australia, millions of people head to the beach, and every year, thousands are rescued by lifeguards or Surf Life Savers and even surfers or other bystanders.

items.title: The parts of Myanmar the military junta don't want you to see
items.description: Myanmar's military is holding its first elections since overthrowing a democratically elected government in 2021. But as it aims to portray a sense of normality, signs of the junta's menacing presence are everywhere.

items.title: 'Bánh mì lover': Vietnamese bakeries go viral on social media
items.description: A humble bánh mì appreciation group created by a Sydneysider has played a pivotal role in reinvigorating Australia's love for Vietnamese baguettes.

items.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy names spy chief as new top aide
items.description: Ukraine's president has named Kyrylo Budanov, a legendary intelligence leader in the country, as the new head of his presidential office.

items.title: Skies will light up again tonight — but this time, it won't be from fireworks
items.description: Stargazers will be treated with a supersized wolf moon for the first weekend of the year. Here's what to know.

items.title: How to set reading goals that aren't just about churning through books
items.description: While some people might find goal setting motivating — such as reading X number of books each year or pages each day — there is a risk of turning what is supposed to be a pleasurable activity into a chore.

items.title: Man charged over ISIS-inspired New Year's Eve attack plans, FBI says
items.description: The US Attorney for the Western District of North Carolina claims the 18-year-old suspect had planned to attack a grocery store and fast food restaurant in his hometown.

items.title: Sydney mother drowned trying to save son from rip in dangerous swell
items.description: The identity of one of four people who died in a cluster of drownings on the New South Wales coast in recent days has been confirmed as a Sydney hairdresser and mother.

items.title: Two decades on, Waugh's last-ball century completes his perfect day
items.description: With one ball remaining on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in 2003, Steve Waugh stared down a century and his own cricketing mortality before securing one of the most famous centuries of his storied career.

items.title: Brumby rehoming program gives wild horses second chance as pets
items.description: About a third of the brumby population on the NSW Mid North Coast has been rehomed through a program designed to give wild horses a second chance as pets.

items.title: ABC 50/50 quiz: Test your knowledge of Kylie Minogue, Greek gods and cards
items.description: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

items.title: Housing demand for pregnant homeless women outstrips supply, experts say
items.description: While the exact number of pregnant women who are homeless in Victoria is unknown, experts say the outsized demand for specialty support services indicates more can be done.

items.title: Christmas seafood sales a 'huge relief' amid algal bloom anxiety
items.description: After a year dominated by the algal bloom, SA's seafood retailers are breathing a small sigh of relief after some promising Christmas sales — but others in the industry have only just been given the all-clear to get back into business.

items.title: Rescue operations underway after coal mine collapse
items.description: One man is in hospital and another is missing following an incident at a Central Queensland coal mine.

items.title: What we learned from Donald Trump's wide-ranging health interview
items.description: US President Donald Trump says he regrets undergoing advanced imagery on his heart and abdomen because of the "ammunition" it handed his critics, but has once more defended his "perfect" health.

items.title: Khawaja hits out at 'racial stereotypes' as he announces Test retirement
items.description: Australia batter Usman Khawaja takes aim at his critics one last time as he announces his retirement from international cricket.

items.title: Khawaja's on-field brilliance pales in comparison to his true impact
items.description: Before his debut in 2011, Australia had never seen a cricketer like Usman Khawaja and, thanks to his work on and off the field, he'll be followed by plenty more.

items.title: Kim Jong Un's daughter visits state mausoleum, fueling heir speculation
items.description: The North Korean leader's daughter, reportedly named Kim Ju Ae, has been making increasingly prominent appearances in state media, fuelling speculation she may be in line to be the country's fourth-generation leader.

items.title: Last-minute citizenship change paves way for figure skater's Olympic debut
items.description: Figure skater Anastasia Golubeva becomes an Australian citizen, just six weeks out from the Milano-Cortina Olympics.
